answers.answer: Don't call yourself stinky.  Alot of people deal with odor.  Some odors can be caused by diabetes, yeast, bacteria, infection, medications, excessive sweating, other secretions, etc.  I promise you that there is a time that every person in your office has not exactly smelled like roses.Make an appointment with your doctor and let he/she know what is going on.  Maybe they can find the cause of it and help treat the problem.  It may just be a simple switching of medications.In the mean time try this:Dont take hot baths or showers, try luke warm water.Shower or bathe only once a day unless you have excessive sweating or you are really dirty.  Bathing too much will dry out your skin.Do not use scented soap or body wash.  This can add to the issues that may be causing  the odor.*This is my favorite because this is what I do-carry a small travel size bottle of Febreeze with you.  Do not spray your body, but spray your clothes a few times throughout the day.  You can also spray around the area you are in if you are worried about air quality of others.  The odor is probably being secreted through your skin  (cannot remember what the condition is caused) and it can collect on your clothing.  The Febreeze can help your clothes smelling fresh.Again, do not call yourself stinky.  You have a medical condition that you cannot help.  Others should be sensitive to your situation.  Also, get your blood pressure down a little more.  You should be seeing your doctor regularly for blood pressure checks, if you are not already.  Do not be afraid to talk to your doctor about the problem you are having.  Doctors are there to help you, so make sure that you accept that help.I hope things get better for you.  Good luck.
